chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Michael G Oleinik was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

records.addlTxt: Fax Transmittal to Atty. Rifelj w/ Clerk's Note

The Courts JA received a telephone message from Department of Health Services regarding the Order for Placement. The Courts JA forwarded the message to my telephone; Vicky from the Department of Health Services Court Liaisons Office conveyed that there may be an error(s) with the Order for Placement. I reviewed the Order and approached the Court with the possibility of errors in the Order for Placement. The Court directed me to prepare an Amended Order for Placement with needed corrections, further the Court directed that I provide a copy to counsel and indicate that there is a 5 day objection period to the amendments

Case called at 10:00am [mo]
Defendant Michael G Oleinik in court with Attorney Nicholas John Rifelj.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court verifies receipt of recommended conditional release plan; State and Defense verify receipt
No objection from the State or Defense as to the recommended conditional release plan

Atty. Rifelj alerts the court to a possible error on the Order for Commitment as to the length of commitment
The Court orders the Clerk to amend the Order for Commitment; it is to the same in all aspects except for under the Orders section, part 2 is to reflect 3 years, 0 months, 0 days.

The Court does approve the conditional release plan, provides protection to public as well as rehabilitation for the Defendant. The Court directs the Clerk to prepare proper order.
recess: 10:15am

[MK] case called briefly at 8:37am. and then again at 8:45am
Defendant Michael G Oleinik in court with Attorney Nicholas J Rifelj.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel acknowledge receipt of the 4/22/16 Pre-Disposition Report, and the parties agree with the proposed Conditional Release. 
The Court finds that Conditional Release is appropriate.  The Court orders DHS and the Chapter 51.42 Board of Jefferson County to prepare a Conditional Release Plan within 21 days.  
The Court continues the Bond and its conditions. 
recess 8:55am.

NEXT:  Hearing on Conditional Release Plan on June 10th at 10:00am

Case called at 1:47pm [mo]
Defendant Michael G Oleinik in court with attorney Nicholas John Rifelj.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall recites the agreement of the parties

Atty. Rifelj recites the Jury Instructions

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST & NGI " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, but not guilty by reason of mental disease/defect

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts

On joint recommendation of the parties, the court orders that a pre-disposition investigation be conducted pursuant to 971.17(2)(a), that will be conducted by the Department of Health Services.
The Court orders the deadline for the report to be filed is 4/25/16.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 2:04pm

NEXT: Dispositional Hearing on 5/12/16 at 8:30am((allow an hour))
